author: sky.cactus
content: ü§î  Do all transaction types need to share a hashing mechanism, or can that be left up to individual transaction types?

author: sky.cactus
content: I don't think it matters, since any hashing algorithm is unlikely to produce any overlap with another for different inputs.  However, it reduces complexity of the specification and client code if we have all transactions share a hashing mechanism.

author: lightclient
content: I think there should be a strong recommendation that they share the same hashing mechanism, but I‚Äôm not sure that it is a requirement for all future tx types

author: axic3354
content:
Tired to collect all suggestions around new transaction features (and added some wishes from me): https://notes.ethereum.org/@axic/Hyrc1i7ED

It is only a rough collection and an attempt to distill all these features into some cohesive set of transaction types/formats.

author: axic3354
content: Added a crazy idea on the bottom of this document where external transaction types are replaced with "rich transaction". I'm curious about the gas cost of those and the complexity they introduce. Likely it is too early to have these introduced.
